intro: Elisanthe turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan elisanthe, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers are often pink or red, adding visual interest to its natural habitat.
